Posts.Content: I am in the middle of chemo and have been having oral thrush too. .on Fluconozole now.   Also recently ordered Candida Gone from Amazon hoping it will clear it. I also have mouth ulcers.  I don't know why because I am so obsessed about keeping my mouth clean. I have been advised to rinse my mouth with extra Virgin olive oil, to prevent infections so I am trying that now.  Hope you get over this nasty side effect soon. Hugs x
Posts.Title: 2 months after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Sinead 12 I am on my second cycle of chemotherapy.  I had a long break between the two cycles as they found more lumps after first chemo. I am tnbc  idc grade 3. After first chemo I lost most of my hair in October. By end of December I had all my hair back thicker than ever. I have actually had fun with my hair. I bought several different types of chemo caps. Also got a wig from the NHS and bought one from amazon.could. uk  Colored my new hair bright red Now I am on second chemo  (restarted posted bilateral mastectomy ) I know I will lose the hair again but it is not a problem now. I have a little boy just turned 4 and it is difficult in the first 5 days after each chemo treatment but if I can get some help in the first week freeze cooked meals when I am well arrange for drop off and pick up help from preschool,I can manage OK It is very hard to find such help. I have accepted help from all who have offered Also have a babysitter coming in more regularly. I am actually thinking of starting a 'mums help during chemo' community group when I am over this. We need cancer organisations to think about so many young mothers dealing with bc  and chemo.they need to have some home help provision  May be Macmillan will do some thing one day?  Hopefully your medical team will help you make the right decision for you. All the best
Posts.Title: isolated cells in nodes

Posts.Content: Every one is different. Loosing hair is not nice and I miss my long thick hair but I tell myself its temporary  The scalp cooling can make the treatment longer, this was not very practical for me. Also I have brca 1 mutation so I am concerned about brain metastases. I spoke to a chemo nurse who is also a friend and she said you really want the chemotherapy to get to all parts of your body.  There is no evidence that using a cold cap increases risk of brain mets . But I chose not to use it.  It is your choice and I completely understand the importance of not wanting to lose your hair. All the decisions are hard. I hope you get the support and treatment you need  xx Take care x

Posts.Title: isolated cells in nodes

Posts.Content: Hello Bedford69 I am really sorry to hear that you lost your loved ones through cancer and now you have to fight it x lots of hugs xxx I am BRCA MUTATION 1. I found last July 2015 that I had a lump (invasive ductal carcinoma,triple negative) then had a lumpectomy, started chemo FEC T in September but after 1st FEC had a leaking breast. Had more biopsies and found two more lumps.  MRI showed two nodules in the right breast which showed Atypical lobular hyperplasia and LCIS. So pushed the doctors for bilateral mastectomy without reconstruction. Also pushed for genetic test.  My mum and dad are fine but both grandmothers and aunts on both sides had breast and or ovarian cancers. On 12th November had bilateral mastectomy and also gother the BRCA results that afternoon.  It is surprising that you are brca mutation negative.  Did they tell you that there are three more less popular genes that you can be tested for? The mastectomy was OK I guess. I am blessed with a lovely family and friends who helped by coming in,bringing food and looking after my son ... in the first couple of weeks.  Your insurance company probably won't cover you post op for 6 weeks -you can call and check in case its different. I didn't drive for 6 weeks but went for regular walks to local shops etc x my drains came out after 5 days but I think  it was too soon as I had to go back to the clinic to get my seroma drained. I had a wound complication which meant another procedure in Jan. .. but this is rare if you don't have a reconstruction.  I am now having FEC T . After that radiotherapy and hysterectomy.  So if you have good surgeons and no complications I think 4 to 6 weeks is a good time for recOvery.  Good luck to you. Xx
